series.title: Ronja, the Robber's Daughter
series.description: Ronja, the Robber's Daughter Kanji 山賊の娘ローニャ Rōmaji Sanzoku no Musume Rōnya Directed by Gorō Miyazaki [ 1 ] Produced by Nobuo Kawakami Written by Gorō Miyazaki Screenplay by Hiroyuki Kawasaki Narrated by Gillian Anderson Starring Haruka Shiraishi Reika Uyama Takaaki Seki Yukari Nozawa Music by Satoshi Takebe Aoi Teshima Production Polygon Pictures Studio Ghibli (Production cooperation) Distributed by NHK BS Premium Release date(s) October 11, 2014 Running time 26 episodes Ronja, the Robber's Daughter (山賊の娘ローニャ, Sanzoku no Musume Rōnya ) is a 26 episode animated television series directed by Gorō Miyazaki and written by Hiroyuki Kawasaki for NHK. It is animated by Polygon Pictures as a production for NHK Enterprises and Dwango. The story is based on the Astrid Lindgren novel of the same name
series.plot: Ronja, the only child of a bandit chief, grows up among a clan of robbers living in a castle in the woodlands of early-Medieval Scandinavia. When Ronja grows old enough she ventures into the forest, exploring and discovering its wonders and dangers like the mystical creatures that dwell there. She learns to live in the forest through her own strength, with the occasional rescue by her parents. Ronja has never met another child until after her 10th birthday, when she happens upon a boy her own age named Birk, who turns out to be the son of the rival clan chief. [ 2 ]

characters.name: Ronja
characters.description: Ronja is the protagonist from the 2014 television series Ronja, the Robber's Daughter , co-produced by Studio Ghibli .

characters.name: Mattis
characters.description: Mattis (マッティス , Mattisu ) a principal character from the 2014 television series Ronja, the Robber's Daughter , co-produced by Studio Ghibli . He is the leader of a clan, and is the father of Ronja .

characters.name: Birk
characters.description: Birk is a principal character from the 2014 television series Ronja, the Robber's Daughter , co-produced by Studio Ghibli . He is a young boy from the Borka clan.

characters.name: Lovis
characters.description: Lovis is a supporting character who appears in Ronja, the Robber's Daughter . She is the mother of Ronja

characters.name: Noddle-Pete
characters.description: Noddle-Pete (スカッレ・ペール, Sukarre pēru ) is a character from Ronja, the Robber's Daughter . He is an old man who stays at the fort. A robber in days gone by, he helps to raise Ronja — teaching, guiding, and keeping her occupied. As an elder to even the chief, Mattis , he freely comments on and scrutinizes the clan's schemes and follies.

characters.name: Undis
characters.description: Undis is a character who appears in Ronja, the Robber's Daughter TV series by Goro Miyazaki .

series.title: Sherlock Hound
series.description: Sherlock Hound Kanji 名探偵ホームズ Rōmaji Meitantei Hōmuzu Directed by Kyosuke Mikuriya (20 episodes) Hayao Miyazaki (6 episodes) Produced by Luciano Scaffa (Head) Yutaka Fujioka Screenplay by Gi Pagot (Italy) Sunao Katabuchi (eps 4-5, 9-10) Based on Sherlock Holmes by Arthur Conan Doyle Music by Kentarō Haneda Studio RAI Tokyo Movie Shinsha Production Yoshifumi Kondō (Character Design) Distributed by TV Asahi Rai 1 Release date(s) November 6, 1984 - May 20, 1985 Sherlock Hound (名探偵ホームズ , Meitantei Hōmuzu , lit. Famous Detective Holmes ) is a 26 episode Italian-Japanese animated television series produced by RAI and Tokyo Movie Shinsha , airing from November 6, 1984, to May 20, 1985.
series.plot: Despite borrowing characters from the original novel by Arthur Conan Doyle, the story for Sherlock Hound is almost entirely original. The cast has been replaced with anthropomorphic dogs, and the dynamic between characters is simplified for children. Professor Moriarty and his subordinates Todd and Smiley are the central villains, whose schemes are thwarted by Holmes and his assistant Dr. Watson. The detective elements are light and instead replaced with the Watson's strange inventions. The added police and chase sequences keep the tone light and fun. Most of the plot in each episode revolves are cases of theft and not murders (although there are depictions of attempted murder in The Little Martha's Great Case and The Adventure of the Speckled Strings ).

series.title: Film Guru Guru
series.description: Film Guru Guru Kanji フィルムぐるぐる Rōmaji Firumu Guru Guru Directed by Hayao Miyazaki Hiromasa Yonebayashi Produced by Toshio Suzuki Studio Studio Ghibli Production Atsuko Tanaka Distributed by Ghibli Museum Release date(s) January 3, 2006 Running time 16 minutes Film Guru Guru (フィルムぐるぐる , Firumu Guru Guru ) is a series of animated short films shown at the Ghibli Museum in Mitaka from October 1, 2001, through November 17, 2008. The series was directed by Hayao Miyazaki with storyboards by Miyazaki and Hiromasa Yonebayashi (who also produced).
series.plot: Film Guru Guru is based on a concept by ​​ Hayao Miyazaki to show audiences how old film projectors worked.  A special projector called Film Guru Guru (literally translated as Film Round and Round ) was installed in the Room of the Beginning of Movement , a permanent exhibition room located in the basement of the Ghibli Museum in Mitaka, Tokyo. An 80-meter film is spun at a speed of 24 frames per second on 124 reels, and short animations are projected on three screens. Additionally, there are three points where the picture appears to move in a single frame by projecting a blinking strobe light directly on the film from behind. This special light blinks at a slightly slower speed than the film's running speed (the light blinks 23.3 times versus 24 frames per second) providing an added dimension to the motion. There are a total of eight short animated works produced for Film Guru Guru . A Splendid Ball , Rambutan Adventures , and Fish Fish , were initially available in a single reel of film when the museum opened on October 1, 2001. Tacolator , Piyopiyo Baba , and Bobo-kun , were added On November 27, 2002. In March 2005, sound effects were added to the exhibit. The film were replaced with Madalan World on April 18, 2007. That film was then replaced with Evolution on November 17, 2008. Madalan World and Evolution do not have sound effects, while the other six films with sound effects were moved into a mini-theater exhibit in the same permanent exhibition area. Film Guru Guru consists of the eight original motion pictures, featuring work by veteran animation director Atsuko Tanaka .

series.title: Ronja the Robber Daughter
series.description: Ronja the Robber's Daughter is a computer-animated cel shaded anime series, based on the book Ronia, the Robber's Daughter (Ronja Rövardotter) written by Astrid Lindgren. The series is directed by Goro Miyazaki and animated by Polygon Pictures, and co-produced by Studio Ghibli .
